subject: Order #SSN2176: faulty shifter
description_text:
Hi,

I've been user my SQ Shifter for a couple of weeks and it started to get
stuck when returning from downshifts. It remains in the forwards position
(-) and won't return. I tried adjusting the force with the instructed
screws, but got no response.

I would like to proceed with a return and reimbursement. Please advise on
next steps.

Best,
Esteban

conversations.body_text: Hi Esteban Araya,  Please provide your order number and upload a video of the issue via Google Drive so that our engineers can assist you more accurately in troubleshooting. A simple and effective method is to loosen the screw securing the ball, remove it, then reinstall it and test again. This will help us confirm the problem more quickly and provide you with an effective solution.      Please note, it’s the red screw.

Hi,

Thanks for getting back to me! I've uploaded a video of the issue here:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1aMTcZ-G6YQ6qaCOxerUSJ-tBeAXyxp7_/view?usp=sharing

I've tried multiple times to reinstall the screws and it hasn't fixed the
issue. I'm able to change the tension, but the shifter never returns to the
middle when I downshift.

How can we proceed with a return and reimbursement given that the unit is
faulty within the first thirty days?

Best,
Esteban

On Sun, Aug 24, 2025 at 10:26 PM service@simsonn.com

Hi Esteban Araya,  This issue should be resolved simply by applying some lubricant to the ball position. The device also requires regular lubrication and maintenance. I have also shared the video with our production team so they can determine whether it is an actual product issue or just a matter of lubrication.

Hi,

Can you please clarify what the "ball" component is? I've had the device
for less than a month and have driven with it maybe 5 times; I'm not
expecting to perform maintenance this early. I'm not satisfied with the
quality of the product and would like to receive a refund.

Best,
Esteban

On Mon, Aug 25, 2025 at 10:47 PM service@simsonn.com

Hello,

I found the ball component you mentioned and lubricated it. There was no
difference.

What I did find is that spring is cracked as you can see in the pictures.
This is causing the shifter to not return to its original position. This is
not an issue I am able to fix on my own.

I really liked the shifter while it was working, but unfortunately the
quality is not sufficient. Again, let's please proceed with a refund.

Best,
Esteban

Hi!

I really appreciate it, but I prefer a refund at this point. I don't feel
satisfied with a product that breaks so quickly.

Best,
Esteban
